speaker: MENENIUS
text: The augurer tells me we shall have news

speaker: MENENIUS
text: tonight.

speaker: BRUTUS
text: Good or bad?

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Not according to the prayer of the people,

speaker: MENENIUS
text: for they love not Martius.

speaker: SICINIUS
text: Nature teaches beasts to know their friends.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Pray you, who does the wolf love?

speaker: SICINIUS
text: The lamb.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Ay, to devour him, as the hungry plebeians

speaker: MENENIUS
text: would the noble Martius.

speaker: BRUTUS
text: He’s a lamb indeed, that baas like a bear.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: He’s a bear indeed, that lives like a lamb.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: You two are old men; tell me one thing that I shall

speaker: MENENIUS
text: ask you.

speaker: BOTH
text: Well, sir.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: In what enormity is Martius poor in, that

speaker: MENENIUS
text: you two have not in abundance?

speaker: BRUTUS
text: He’s poor in no one fault, but stored with all.

speaker: SICINIUS
text: Especially in pride.

speaker: BRUTUS
text: And topping all others in boasting.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: This is strange now. Do you two know how

speaker: MENENIUS
text: you are censured here in the city, I mean of us o’

speaker: MENENIUS
text: th’ right-hand file, do you?

speaker: BOTH
text: Why, how are we censured?

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Because you talk of pride now, will you not

speaker: MENENIUS
text: be angry?

speaker: BOTH
text: Well, well, sir, well?

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Why, ’tis no great matter; for a very little

speaker: MENENIUS
text: thief of occasion will rob you of a great deal of patience.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Give your dispositions the reins, and be

speaker: MENENIUS
text: angry at your pleasures, at the least, if you take it

speaker: MENENIUS
text: as a pleasure to you in being so. You blame Martius

speaker: MENENIUS
text: for being proud.

speaker: BRUTUS
text: We do it not alone, sir.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: I know you can do very little alone, for

speaker: MENENIUS
text: your helps are many, or else your actions would

speaker: MENENIUS
text: grow wondrous single. Your abilities are too infantlike

speaker: MENENIUS
text: for doing much alone. You talk of pride. O,

speaker: MENENIUS
text: that you could turn your eyes toward the napes

speaker: MENENIUS
text: of your necks and make but an interior survey of

speaker: MENENIUS
text: your good selves! O, that you could!

speaker: BOTH
text: What then, sir?

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Why, then you should discover a brace of

speaker: MENENIUS
text: unmeriting, proud, violent, testy magistrates, alias

speaker: MENENIUS
text: fools, as any in Rome.

speaker: SICINIUS
text: Menenius, you are known well enough, too.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: I am known to be a humorous patrician and

speaker: MENENIUS
text: one that loves a cup of hot wine with not a drop of

speaker: MENENIUS
text: allaying Tiber in ’t; said to be something imperfect

speaker: MENENIUS
text: in favoring the first complaint, hasty and tinder-like

speaker: MENENIUS
text: upon too trivial motion; one that converses

speaker: MENENIUS
text: more with the buttock of the night than with the

speaker: MENENIUS
text: forehead of the morning. What I think I utter,

speaker: MENENIUS
text: and spend my malice in my breath. Meeting two

speaker: MENENIUS
text: such wealsmen as you are—I cannot call you

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Lycurguses—if the drink you give me touch my

speaker: MENENIUS
text: palate adversely, I make a crooked face at it. I cannot

speaker: MENENIUS
text: say your Worships have delivered the matter

speaker: MENENIUS
text: well when I find the ass in compound with the

speaker: MENENIUS
text: major part of your syllables. And though I must

speaker: MENENIUS
text: be content to bear with those that say you are reverend

speaker: MENENIUS
text: grave men, yet they lie deadly that tell you

speaker: MENENIUS
text: have good faces. If you see this in the map of my

speaker: MENENIUS
text: microcosm, follows it that I am known well enough

speaker: MENENIUS
text: too? What harm can your bisson conspectuities

speaker: MENENIUS
text: glean out of this character, if I be known well

speaker: MENENIUS
text: enough, too?

speaker: BRUTUS
text: Come, sir, come; we know you well enough.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: You know neither me, yourselves, nor anything.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: You are ambitious for poor knaves’ caps

speaker: MENENIUS
text: and legs. You wear out a good wholesome forenoon

speaker: MENENIUS
text: in hearing a cause between an orange-wife

speaker: MENENIUS
text: and a faucet-seller, and then rejourn the controversy

speaker: MENENIUS
text: of threepence to a second day of audience.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: When you are hearing a matter between party and

speaker: MENENIUS
text: party, if you chance to be pinched with the colic,

speaker: MENENIUS
text: you make faces like mummers, set up the bloody

speaker: MENENIUS
text: flag against all patience, and, in roaring for a

speaker: MENENIUS
text: chamber pot, dismiss the controversy bleeding,

speaker: MENENIUS
text: the more entangled by your hearing. All the peace

speaker: MENENIUS
text: you make in their cause is calling both the parties

speaker: MENENIUS
text: knaves. You are a pair of strange ones.

speaker: BRUTUS
text: Come, come. You are well understood to be a

speaker: BRUTUS
text: perfecter giber for the table than a necessary

speaker: BRUTUS
text: bencher in the Capitol.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Our very priests must become mockers if

speaker: MENENIUS
text: they shall encounter such ridiculous subjects as

speaker: MENENIUS
text: you are. When you speak best unto the purpose, it

speaker: MENENIUS
text: is not worth the wagging of your beards, and your

speaker: MENENIUS
text: beards deserve not so honorable a grave as to

speaker: MENENIUS
text: stuff a botcher’s cushion or to be entombed in an

speaker: MENENIUS
text: ass’s packsaddle. Yet you must be saying Martius is

speaker: MENENIUS
text: proud, who, in a cheap estimation, is worth all

speaker: MENENIUS
text: your predecessors since Deucalion, though peradventure

speaker: MENENIUS
text: some of the best of ’em were hereditary

speaker: MENENIUS
text: hangmen. Good e’en to your Worships. More of

speaker: MENENIUS
text: your conversation would infect my brain, being

speaker: MENENIUS
text: the herdsmen of the beastly plebeians. I will be

speaker: MENENIUS
text: bold to take my leave of you.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: How now, my as fair as noble ladies—and the

speaker: MENENIUS
text: moon, were she earthly, no nobler—whither do

speaker: MENENIUS
text: you follow your eyes so fast?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: Honorable Menenius, my boy Martius approaches.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: For the love of Juno, let’s go!

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Ha? Martius coming home?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: Ay, worthy Menenius, and with most prosperous

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: approbation.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Take my cap, Jupiter, and I thank thee!

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Hoo! Martius coming

speaker: MENENIUS
text: home?

speaker:
VALERIA
              ,
               
              VIRGILIA
text: Nay, ’tis true.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: Look, here’s a letter from him.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: The state hath another, his wife another,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: and I think there’s one at home for you.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: I will make my very house reel tonight. A

speaker: MENENIUS
text: letter for me?

speaker: VIRGILIA
text: Yes, certain, there’s a letter for you; I saw ’t.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: A letter for me? It gives me an estate of

speaker: MENENIUS
text: seven years’ health, in which time I will make a lip

speaker: MENENIUS
text: at the physician. The most sovereign prescription

speaker: MENENIUS
text: in Galen is but empiricutic and, to this preservative,

speaker: MENENIUS
text: of no better report than a horse drench. Is he not

speaker: MENENIUS
text: wounded? He was wont to come home wounded.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text: O no, no, no!

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: O, he is wounded, I thank the gods for ’t.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: So do I too, if it be not too much. Brings he

speaker: MENENIUS
text: victory in his pocket, the wounds become him.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: On ’s brows, Menenius. He comes the third

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: time home with the oaken garland.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Has he disciplined Aufidius soundly?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: Titus Lartius writes they fought together,

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: but Aufidius got off.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: And ’twas time for him too, I’ll warrant him

speaker: MENENIUS
text: that. An he had stayed by him, I would not have

speaker: MENENIUS
text: been so ’fidiused for all the chests in Corioles and

speaker: MENENIUS
text: the gold that’s in them. Is the Senate possessed of

speaker: MENENIUS
text: this?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: Good ladies, let’s go.—Yes, yes, yes. The

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: Senate has letters from the General, wherein he

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: gives my son the whole name of the war. He hath

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: in this action outdone his former deeds doubly.

speaker: VALERIA
text: In troth, there’s wondrous things spoke of

speaker: VALERIA
text: him.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Wondrous? Ay, I warrant you, and not without

speaker: MENENIUS
text: his true purchasing.

speaker: VIRGILIA
text: The gods grant them true.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: True? Pow waw!

speaker: MENENIUS
text: True? I’ll be sworn they are true. Where is

speaker: MENENIUS
text:
he wounded?

               God save your

speaker: MENENIUS
text: good Worships! Martius is coming home; he has

speaker: MENENIUS
text: more cause to be proud.—Where is he wounded?

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: I’ th’ shoulder and i’ th’ left arm. There will

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: be large cicatrices to show the people when he

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: shall stand for his place. He received in the repulse

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: of Tarquin seven hurts i’ th’ body.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: One i’ th’ neck and two i’ th’ thigh—there’s

speaker: MENENIUS
text: nine that I know.

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: He had, before this last expedition, twenty-five

speaker: VOLUMNIA
text: wounds upon him.

speaker: MENENIUS
text: Now it’s twenty-seven. Every gash was an

speaker: MENENIUS
text:
enemy’s grave.
